contentrichtext.text: {{refimprove|date=April 2013}} {{Infobox SMS station | img = yeouido05.jpg | caption = Yeouido Station (Line 5) | hangul = {{linktext|여|의|도|역}} | hanja = {{linktext|汝|矣|島|驛}} | rr = Yeouido-yeok | mr = Yŏŭido-yŏk | line = s05 | prev = Singil | next = Yeouinaru | number = 526 | address = 3 [[Yeouido-dong]], <br/> 40 Yeouinaruro, <br/> [[Yeongdeungpo-gu]], [[Seoul]] | operator = [[Seoul Metropolitan Rapid Transit Corporation|SMRT]] | opened = August 12, 1996 | type = Underground | platforms = 2 | tracks = 2 | line_2 = s09 | prev_2 = National Assembly | next_2 = Saetgang | number_2 = 915 | address_2 = 40 Yeouinaruro, <br/> [[Yeongdeungpo-gu]], [[Seoul]] | operator_2 = [[Seoul Metro Line 9 Corporation|Seoul Line 9 Co.]] | opened_2 = July 24, 2009 | type_2 = Underground | platforms_2 = 2 | tracks_2 = 2 }} '''Yeouido Station''' is a subway station on [[Seoul Subway Line 5|Line 5]] and [[Seoul Subway Line 9|Line 9]] on the [[Seoul Metropolitan Subway|Seoul Subway]] system. It is one of the stations that serve the [[eponymous]] island of [[Yeouido]], one of the great financial hubs of [[Seoul]]. The large Yeouido Park is close to this station. A new subway line starting from Yeouido is planned to break ground in December 2011 heading south.{{cn|date=April 2013}} ==Vicinity== * Exit 1: Gwangjang APT * Exit 2: Financial Supervisory Service, KT * Exit 3: [[National Assembly of South Korea]], Yeouido Park, [[Korean Broadcasting System]] (KBS) * Exit 4: Small Business Corporation * Exit 5: [[Korea Exchange]], [[Munhwa Broadcasting Corporation]] (MBC) * Exit 6: Yunjung Elementary School, Yunjung Middle School, Yeouido Saetgang Ecological Park ==Attractions== * [[IFC Seoul]]: IFC Office Towers, IFC Mall Seoul and Conrad Seoul Hotel.<ref>{{cite news|last=Rahn|first=Kim|title=Conrad Seoul new hositality landmark|work=Korea Times|date=15 November 2012|url=http://koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/culture/2012/11/135_124814.html|accessdate=25 April 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Enjoy smart stay at Conrad Seoul|work=Korea Times|date=26 December 2012|url=http://koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/culture/2012/12/135_127720.html|accessdate=25 April 2013}}</ref> The station is connected to the complex by a moving walkway, and is approximately two kilometers from Line 5.<ref>{{cite news|last=Cha|first=Frances|title=IFC Mall opens in Seoul|url=http://travel.cnn.com/seoul/shop/ifc-mall-opens-seoul-319768|accessdate=15 October 2012|newspaper=CNN Travel|date=30 August 2012}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{S-start}} {{S-rail|title=SMS}} {{S-line|system=SMS|line=Line 5|previous=Singil|next=Yeouinaru|type2=Both}} {{S-line|system=SMS|line=Line 9|branch=Express|previous=Dangsan|next=Noryangjin|type=Gimpo Airport}} {{S-line|system=SMS|line=Line 9|branch=Local|previous=National Assembly|next=Saetgang|type=Gaehwa}} {{End}} {{Seoul Metropolitan Subway}} {{coord|37|31|18|N|126|55|27|E|region:KR_source:kolossus-jawiki|display=title}} [[Category:Railway stations in South Korea]] [[Category:Seoul subway stations]] [[Category:Yeongdeungpo District]] [[Category:Railway stations opened in 1996]]
